#Text=Not any more ?
#Text=Now the journalists and the people in power , the government and financial world , they 're all of the same class , which is privileged class .
#Text=Journalists are people who are distant from those who are " The Deciders " , to use Bush 's phrase .

column1: #Text=I think there is an all-inclusiveness , and I think the Washington Press Corp is representative of what I am saying .
#Text=They co-mingle ; they live in the same neighborhoods and they go to the same places .
#Text=The Washington Press Corp. is the worst .
#Text=Did you see Stephen Colbert roast the Washington Press Corp and Bush at the White House Press Correspondence dinner ?
#Text=Nobody laughed , because they were all coming from the same place .
#Text=And it got a bad review , and then a revised review !
#Text=The first account I read -- I did n't see it or watch it -- was that it was boring .
#Text=Then it took on a life of its own !
#Text=Because nobody reported about it , or they just said he bombed .

#Text=Then it went out on the internet and took on a life of its own and people said , " This is n't bombing , this a roasting of the entire power structure and the power structure decided they did n't like it . "
#Text=I feel the Washington Press Corp. should be broken up .
#Text=Just have them distributed around the country .
#Text=Put them in state capitals and just feed the state capitals with more reporters and have them feed the big papers .
#Text=Cover the country not from Washington .
#Text=It 's so federalized .
#Text=More state 's rights kind of reporting ; represent power across the country not just overloaded in one place .
#Text=A view of the federal government from the national scene ?
#Text=" Here in Denver the reaction to Washington ...
